result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Extradition Forecast

[MK] cases #22CF147 and #2CF467 called at 2:49pm
Defendant Arturo Lira Torres not in court. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa in court as to Case #22CF147 only. ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Spanish Interpreter S.S. is present.
 
In Case #22CF147:  the Court issues a Bench Warrant-Body Only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate, with a limitless geo-restriction. 
The Court cancels the Jury Trial set for October 31st in Case #22CF147.

In Case #22CF467 the Court issues a Probable Cause Warrant. 
recess 2:54pm

[ma] Case called at 3:20 PM 
Defendant Arturo Lira Torres in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Arturo Lira Torres.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Patrick Ryan sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant. 

Attorney De La Rosa indicates that resolution has not been reached; requests a trial be scheduled. 
--no objection from ADA Witt

recess: 3:24pm 
NEXT: (1)FSSC on 10/25/22 at 2:30pm  (2)Jury Trial on 10/31/22 at 8:15pm

[Court Reporter: Lisa Kwasigroch]
Defendant Arturo Lira Torres in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sylvia Dahnert sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant.

ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 

Arraignment occurs:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:11am

Arraignment on July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:11 AM.  Clerk - CRHI
Defendant Arturo Lira Torres in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Defendant Arturo Lira Torres in custody.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant.

Deputy K. Ritzman sworn and testifies:
-  Direct examination by ADA Beck
-  Cross examination by Atty. De La Rosa

Arguments presented by Counsel. 
Atty. De La Rosa foreshadows potential challenges depending on future charges. 
Court finds probable cause that the Defendant committed a felony.  Court binds the Defendant over for trial.

Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Case continued for ARGN on 7/5/22 at 9am
Recess 9:34am

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
ARGN - 7/5/22 at 9am
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 8:47am 
Defendant Arturo Lira Torres in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Eric Rohland is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today and the State's officer-witness is present.  However Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he was just appointed as counsel, so the Defense is requesting that the hearing be rescheduled. 
recess 8:52am

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on June 3rd at 9:00am

records.addlTxt: Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to Seal Victim Key

[ml] Case called at 2:11PM
Defendant Arturo Lira Torres appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Spanish Interpreter Elizabeth Berrera sworn in; present at jail with Defendant.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing as soon as it is able to. Defense does not object.

ADA Shock advises that the Defendant is currently on a DOC hold.

The Court requires a $100.00 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1, Victim 2, or Witness 1
--no acts or threats of violence

recess 2:22PM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 04/05 at 8:30AM
